result.execSummary:
All charges against Samantha L Peterson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samantha L Peterson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha L Peterson

records.addlTxt: Will Davis from the State of Wisconsin and Attorney David Anderson for the defendant appeared in court prior to hearing on 10/28/22. State moved to dismiss. Case dismissed.
Pre-trial conference on October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Samantha L Peterson in court, in custody.  Attorney David Kennedy Anderson in court for Samantha L Peterson.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties request PTC.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Luke P. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

08:33 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Dominic Richards.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
